Concept intro: This concept introduces the broad themes of control systems and covers the entire first chapter of the textbook. This is an important chapter to cover to ensure that you are familiar with the ideas around control systems, and the terminology used when discussing them.

This concept commences Chapter 3 of the textbook, with each section aligned with each subsequent concept in this topic. (Chapter 2 was not part of the first edition and is considered "optional" — in our opinion it introduces too many advanced concepts too early, but we'd love to hear what you think if you dive into it.) In this concept, we introduce at a high level how we think about dynamical systems (both linear and nonlinear) and explore their characteristics.

In this concept, the two ideas of linearity and time-invariance are introduced. Together, these define the ‘linear time-invariant’ (LTI) system which underpins much of classical control.
